current.hero-how-p: See why Blizzard's collection is perfect for your space
current.how-blog-title: Shine a Light on Your Message
current.how-blog-excerpt:
Baptisms. Weddings. Rockin’ concerts. Confirmations. Funerals. Sunday Worship. The list goes on. We get the picture. You’ve got a space that does it all, and you need a lighting design that’s just as flexible.

We’ve outfitted quite a few houses of worship over the years and if there’s one thing we’ve learned, it’s all about the right mix of lights — and maybe a LED video wall — to give you the versatility you need. Whether you’ve got a tight budget, limited space, or both, you’ve got to know how to stretch your dollar and rig real estate as far as they’ll go.
current.how-blog-pullquote: You’ve got a space that does it all, and you need a lighting design that’s just as flexible.
current.how-cs-title: The Visual Impact of Video Walls
current.how-cs-excerpt:
When the Rock Family Worship Center in Huntsville, AL purchased a sprawling 50-year-old high school in 2015, they knew they had an opportunity to create something bold.

More than two years later the space has been transformed into a multi-use facility including a performance theater, a children’s center and an open commons with its own coffee shop. The jewel of the new church is a 1,500 seat auditorium reconstructed from the school gymnasium where primary services are held.

In order to create a dynamic, impactful space they turned to an impactful, dynamic tool. The church installed a 108-panel, 10x30-foot LED video wall to sit directly above the main stage in the auditorium. Jimi Zink is the church’s Technical Director. He turned to Blizzard and their IRiS™ R3 video wall...
current.how-cs-pullquote: “Our biggest deciding factor on a LED wall is the manufacturer’s support. " Jimi Zink, Church Technical Director
current.how-tf-p: Our versatile line of lights and video walls will let your chruch be creative and flexible. Especially when you transition from baptism to funeral or weddings to Sunday service.

settings.header_title: The At Full™ app puts capabilities of a lighting console right in the palm of your hand.

settings.question: What is At Full?
settings.answer: At Full is an application developed by Blizzard Lighting, LLC that allows you to set up and control lighting fixtures with Art-Net or sACN via WiFi. With the app, you can create dynamic light shows using an array of tools that can help bring your fixtures to life. These tools range from a basic, virtual console to complex fades and animations. It’s compatible with tablets and mobile phones, and is available to download at the Google Play Store and the Apple App Store.

settings.question: What are the minimum requirements to use At Full?
settings.answer: At Full requires a mobile device or tablet on Android or iOS, and a controllable device. All devices will require either a wireless Art-Net or sACN converter (like SoC-It) that re-transmits the signal to a wired DMX cable, or a fixture with compatible wireless capabilities already built in (like Hemisphere).

settings.question: Is the At Full app free to download?
settings.answer: Yes, the basic "Roadie" version of At Full is 100% free to download. Users then have the option to upgrade to the "Pro" version, which has advanced features, for either a monthly ($3.99) or annual ($39.99) subscription via the app store.

settings.question: Can I control any lighting fixture with At Full?
settings.answer: If your lighting fixture does not have wireless capabilities, you can still use At Full by utilizing a wireless converter (like SoC-It). Your fixtures must have DMX capabilities in order to use these devices.

settings.question: Do I need a SoC-It device to use this app?
settings.answer: No, a SoC-It is not required. However, using the device with At Full does provide extra functionality which would be otherwise unavailable, such as live-recording shows, and monitoring traffic.

settings.question: What is a patch?
settings.answer: A patch is a collection of lighting fixtures. This can include the lights in your living room, or a full concert hall.

settings.question: Why are my fixtures not reacting to commands once the patch is configured?
settings.answer:
If you aren’t getting a response from any of your fixtures, chances are there is either a network issue, or the device you are connecting to is preoccupied (e.g. your SoC-It is currently playing a recording).

If only some of your fixtures are responding, double check that your DMX addresses, universes, and devices are properly assigned for each fixture.

settings.question: Can I connect to multiple universes using At Full?
settings.answer: Absolutely! Once you have each of your devices configured, there is no limit to how many universes you can control at the same time. Keep in mind that if any of your patched fixtures are assigned to broadcast, rather than a specific device, the entire patch will only be sent via broadcast.

settings.question: What does broadcast mean?
settings.answer: When patching a fixture in At Full, you are asked to link it to a network device. If you choose broadcast, all of the data will be sent to all of the fixtures on the network, which uses a considerable amount of bandwidth. The network can also get congested if it's used for more than just lighting.  When you link At Full directly to a fixture, data is sent to it specifically which is less susceptible to latency.

settings.question: What happens if I lose access to the internet?
settings.answer: At Full will keep track of any changes you make to patches and shows while you’re offline. However, to ensure that everything is stored more securely and across all of your devices, it's recommended to use At Full while connected to the internet.

settings.question: What are At Full's system requirements?
settings.answer:
Android: Android 9+ | 
iPhone: iOS 13.0 or later  | 
iPad: iPadOS 13.0 or later  | 
Mac: Requires macOS 11.0 or later and a Mac with Apple M1 chip.

settings.headline:
Dream it.
Build it.
Control It.
settings.paragraph: The At Full lighting app from Blizzard Lighting allows you to bring fixtures and ideas to life with its intuitive show editor, real-time miniconsole controls, and an extensive library of fixture profiles — all from the palm of your hand.

settings.headline:
Do More with
At Full™ Pro
settings.paragraph: At Full Pro is a premium version of our lighting control app, offering users even more creative options. With Pro you can add custom animations & effects to show timelines with the touch of a button. A brand new FX panel allows users to switch between shows, including a tap tempo + custom overrides, and more!

settings.headline: Browse the IRiS Lineup
settings.subheadline: Find the perfect LED video wall for your next project

settings.title: Installation
settings.copy: Whether you’re building a permanent, 24/7 install, or taking your panels on the road, we have options that cover a variety of use cases.

settings.title: Environment
settings.copy: Certain video panels are rated to be installed indoors, outdoors, or both. Different panels are built for different needs.

settings.title: Pixel Pitch
settings.copy: The pixel pitch (PP) of a panel defines how close you can get to the video panel without a loss of resolution. The lower the number, the closer you can get without any loss of quality.

settings.title: Refresh Rate
settings.copy: The refresh rate affects how quickly your video panel responds to changes. A high refresh rate is essential to highly visual presentations, where a still image does not need as high refresh.
